intro: Asterochlaena hieronymi subvar. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved starleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that are arranged in a compact, star-like cluster. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
